meanings.definition: A rough path or road, typically one beaten by use from people or animals.
meanings.sent1: The deer left a track through the forest.
meanings.sent2: The hikers followed the track up the mountain.
meanings.sent3: The track made by the kids running around the playground was easy to spot.
meanings.sent4: Her footsteps left a track in the fresh snow.
meanings.sent5: The track winding through the meadow was overgrown with wildflowers.

meanings.definition: A continuous line of rails on a railroad.
meanings.sent1: The train traveled along the track to reach its destination.
meanings.sent2: The maintenance crew inspected the track for any signs of damage.
meanings.sent3: The track stretched out into the distance, disappearing into the horizon.
meanings.sent4: The track gleamed in the sunlight, a path of steel and strength.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the train on the track echoed through the valley.

meanings.definition: A mark or line of marks left by something that has passed.
meanings.sent1: The tire tracks in the mud showed where the car had been stuck.
meanings.sent2: The animal tracks in the snow indicated a fox had passed by.
meanings.sent3: The messy tracks of paint on the floor showed where the artist had worked.
meanings.sent4: The tracks of tears on her cheeks revealed her sadness.
meanings.sent5: The tracks of the storm left destruction in their wake.
